page.title: 07Collyer's Pit
page.content: The Collyer's Pit is a tiny hollow almost hidden on the side of Portsdown Hill. In the old days flints were dug there and used to build several local churches including St. Mary's Church, Portsea. A handful of people live in the 18th Century flint cottages with their 14 inch thick walls and their two up, two down rooms. There is also some modern development. In the middle of a modern community it is, in some ways, an isolated life. The dustman call regularly, but the residents were snowed in for five days early in 1985 and the children have to go two miles to the nearest school. The remains of the similar, but deeper Candy's Pit can be seen just West of the London Road near the top of the hill.
